Directions: Read this poem. Then answer the questions. Some questions may ask you about certain lines. The lines are numbered on the left side.
Title: Uncoiling
Author: by Pat Mora
Content: on my window, tosses her hair dark with rain,
head thrown back, eyes closed, roars
spooks pale women who scurry to
when her tumbleweed skirt starts its spin.
to sleep, sand stinging her ankles,
whirring into her raw skin like stars.

References: cholla — varieties of cacti with needlelike spines found mainly in the southwestern United States and Mexico
